clinical_study.brief_title: DC Vaccine Combined With CIK Cells in Patients With SCLC
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Therapeutic Efficacy of DC Vaccine Combined With Cytokine-induced Killer Cells in Patients With Extensive-Stage Small- Cell Lung Cancer: a Phase I/II Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Affiliated Hospital to Academy of Military Medical Sciences

clinical_study.source: Affiliated Hospital to Academy of Military Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of dendritic cells (DC) combined with cytokine-induced killer (CIK) cells treatment patients with Extensive-Stage Small-Cell Lung Cancer. Experimental adopted recombinant adenovirus-code MUC1 and Survivin transfected DC, which are used for DC-based immunotherapy. Based on the results of our previously preclinical research with DC combined with CIK cells, the investigators plan to perform the clinical trial.

primary_outcome.measure: objective rate response (CR+PR) as measured by RECIST criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: number of participants with adverse events

intervention.intervention_name: adenovirus-transfected autologous DC vaccine plus CIK cells

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histopathologically confirmed diagnosis of Small- Cell Lung Cancer
- Age >18 years at time of consent
- Received standardized treatment of Small-Cell Lung Cancer
- Interval between the last standardized treatment and DC/CIK treatment â‰¥ 4weeks
- KPS (Karnofsky performance scale) >60
- Patient's written informed consent
- No severe viral or bacterial infections
- Predicted survival >3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically relevant diseases or infections (HBV, HCV, HIV)
- Females who are pregnant or nursing
- Immunosuppressant treatment
- Currently participating in another clinical trial
- Unfit for participating in this clinical trial in investigators' opinions
